Low level functions

Functions for low level control of the problem.

Mire.mat_force — Function.
mat_force(N::Integer, vs, forcefun::Function, a::T, b::T, c::T, args...) where T

Allocates new matrix A and fills elements by calling matforcegalerkin!(A,vs,N,forcefun,a,b,c, args...).

Cached version: mat_force(N,cmat,vs,forcefun,a,b,c, args...)

where cmat[i,j,k] contains the integrals of monomials xⁱyʲzᵏ.

#Arguments:

  • N: DESCRIPTION
  • vs: DESCRIPTION
  • forcefun: DESCRIPTION
  • a: DESCRIPTION
  • b: DESCRIPTION
  • c: DESCRIPTION
  • args: DESCRIPTION
source
Mire.mat_force_galerkin! — Function.

Mire.vel — Function.
vel(N,a,b,c)

Compute all velocity basis vectors for a given maximal degree N (Lebovitz 1989, eq. 41-42)

source
Mire.eigenvel — Function.
eigenvel(N,vs,αs,a,b,c; norm=true)

Reconstructs velocity u, following Vidal & Cebron 2017 eq. (3.5).

If norm keyword is set true the velocity is normalised to satisfy $\int u\cdot u dV=1$.

source
Mire.int_ellipsoid_surface — Function.

Integral over the surface of an ellipsoid.

source

Mire.inner_product — Function.
inner_product(u,v,a,b,c)

Defines inner product in an ellipsoidal volume $\int\langle u,v\rangle dV$.

source
